Publications

Highlights

(For a full list see below or go to ResearcherGate)

Validation of fault displacements from dynamic rupture simulations against the observations from the 1992 Landers earthquake

Yongfei Wang, Christine A. Goulet

Bulletin of the Seismological Society of America (2021)

PDF

1. We propose a process for predicting fault displacements using dynamic rupture modeling

2. We compare a dynamic rupture model against observations from the Landers earthquake

3. The results show promise for using dynamic rupture models of fault displacements in probabilistic assessments



Comparison of Near-Fault Displacement Interpretations from Field and Aerial Data for the M6.4 and M7.1 Ridgecrest Earthquake Sequence Ruptures

Christine A. Goulet, Yongfei Wang, Chukwuebuka C. Nweke, Bo-xiang Tang, Pengfei Wang, Kenneth S. Hudson, Sean K. Ahdi, Xiaofeng Meng, Martin B. Hudson, Andrea Donnellan, Greg Lyzenga, Scott J. Brandenberg, Jonathan P. Stewart, Timu Gallien, Maria A. Winters and Kenneth W. Hudnut

Bulletin of the Seismological Society of America (2021)

PDF

1. Engineering infrastructure seismic design is often controlled by potential fault displacements.

2. Accurate quantification of on- and off-fault displacements is needed for scientific and engineering modeling.

3. Collection with cross-validation of displacement data from complementary methods (field and aerial) is ideal



Effects of off‐fault inelasticity on near‐fault directivity pulses

Yongfei Wang and Steven M. Day

Journal of Geophysical Research-Solid Earth (2020)

doi:10.1029/2019JB019074 PDF

1. Off-fault plasticity reshapes directivity pulses by reducing peak velocity and increasing dominant period

2. Yielding causes peak ground velocity to saturate with respect to increases in both stress drop and epicentral distance

3. Off-fault plasticity suppresses the high-frequency fault-parallel pulses that otherwise develop when rupture breaks free surface



Geometric Controls on Pulse‐Like Rupture in a Dynamic Model of the 2015 Gorkha Earthquake

Yongfei Wang, Steven M. Day and Marine A. Denolle

Journal of Geophysical Research-Solid Earth (2019)

doi:10.1029/2018JB016602 PDF

1. Dynamic rupture model isconsistent with the 2015 Gorkhaearthquake slip‐pulse duration andpropagation speed

2. Time‐dependent features of theGorkha earthquake are influencedby rupture geometry andfree‐surface reflections

3. Constraints from near‐field GPSrecording imply no significantrupture of a shallow ramp



Seismic Source Spectral Properties of Crack‐like and Pulse‐like Modes of Dynamic Rupture

Yongfei Wang and Steven M. Day

Journal of Geophysical Research-Solid Earth (2017)

doi:10.1002/2017jb014454 PDF

JGR Editor’s Highlights

Model repository

1. Corner frequency changes incrack-like and pulse-like models

2. Stress drop estimate varies withsource characteristics

3. Double spectral decay slopes



Fourth-Order staggered-grid Finite-difference seismic wavefield estimation using a discontinuous mesh interface (WEDMI)

Shiying Nie, Yongfei Wang, Kim B. Olsen and Steven M. Day

Bulletin of the Seismological Society of America (2017)

doi:10.1785/0120170077 PDF

1. Strong ground motion simulation

2. Discontinuous mesh finite difference

3. Scheme accuracy and stability
